bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 15, 1900

div1.p: Lazear, writing as William Lazear, describes his son's daily life.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 15, 1900
div1.p:
I thought
perhaps you would like
to hear from your
little grandson. And
as I am such a tiny
little Boy. and have
not learned to write
yet. I -get Gertrude
to write for me and
I take great pleasure
in telling her what
to say to you. I can
speak very good baby
english. But Gertrude
and mama does'nt
seem to understand
me. Gertrude laughs
2
when I am talking to
her and says I am
speaking spanish,
first I will say I
am very well and
hope -grandmother
that you are well
I like Cuba very much
for I goes -driving
some times. And
has been to the
beach several times
with Mama and
Gertrude. And had
lots of fun playing
in the sand and
picking up pretty shells
Mama taken my
picture on the beach
and I thinks it is
realy Cute.

Gertrude and I has
a room together
and sometimes I
awake very early and
tries to get Gertrude to
play but I dont think
she is fond of play-
ing- early in the
morning.

Gertrude and I takes
long walks every after-
noon and morning I
can walk very good
for a little boy of
my age. And it is
some little chickens here
and oh) I have so -
much fun running
after them.

Now I must close as
I cannot think of any
thing interesting to
write you. Mama
Papa and Gertrude
sends. love. And
except a large share
from me.
div1.closer:
I am your Loving
little grandson William H. Lazear Houston.
